E. FLOOD & CO., North West Connectors, Bankers and Brokers, Real Estate, Insurance and Financial Agents.

D. H. MACDOWALL, ESQ., North West Connector.

We, the undersigned residents of the District of Lorne, being fully convinced in your integrity and ability to represent us on the North West Committee, hereby publicly announce, should you decide to accept our request, that we shall be pleased to support you in your endeavours to secure your election, and feel assured and confident that you will receive the suffrages of the entire electorate. Trusting that in the interests of the country at large you will continue to stand forward as our candidate, and permit us to publicly announce you as such.

We are,

Dear Sir,

Yours faithfully,

L. Clarke, Honorary North West Councillor.
C. Mair,
H. T. McKeown,
Philip Turner,
J. R. McPhail,
Bernard Bremer,
C. E. Young,
James Macdonald,
John B. Smith,

Alexander Mitchell,
J. Hanigan, etc.

REQUISITION

To D. H. MACDOWALL, ESQ.,
PRINCE ALBERT.

SOUTH BRANCH, March 1883.

Sir,

We, the undersigned residents of the South Branch Settlement, having been informed of your abilities and influence, respectfully request you to become a candidate to represent us as a member of the North West Council, for the District of Lorne, and in the event of your consenting, freely give ourselves to support and vote for you at the coming election.

We are,

Yours respectfully,

Edward Taylor,
John H. Gordon,
George Tait,
William Macdonald,
Philip Turner,
Patrick Anderson,
François Fournier,
George Whittard,
George J. Whitford,
John Atkin,
Adam Ishamter,
Robert Harper,
James B. Mack,
John Donald,
James Campbell,
Alexander McBeth,
Jeremiah Stevens,
J. E. W. Brown,
Bernard Browner.

REPLY

Prince Albert, Feb. 27, 1883.

Gentlemen,

I beg to acknowledge receipt of your letter of this date, requesting me to allow myself to be brought forward as a candidate for the North West Council, for the District of Lorne, and in the event of your consent, freely give yourself to support and vote for me at the coming election.

We are,

Yours respectfully,

D. H. MACDOWALL.

Caledonian Restaurant and Saloon.

MEALS AT ALL HOURS.

HOP BEER.

PRICES ON THE MENU.

PRICES REDUCED.

LIBRARY AND POST OFFICE IN CONNECTION.

GEORGE A. MILLER, PROPRIETOR.
The Prince Albert Times

Wednesday, April 11, 1883

DOMINION LANDS

No more important measure was ever taken on the part of the government than the passage of the Dominion Lands Act; and there can be no doubt whatever in the statement and consolidation of the Dominion Lands Act. We cannot see why such a bill should have been passed at this juncture. It seems to be somewhat late in the day, but it will do no harm to give an expression of our views on the subject. We believe there are many defects in the law, as it stands at present cannot be gainsaid. Much more consideration should have been given to the question of the Act before its passage into law. We want to say that the Dominion Lands Act is a good law, and we believe the Government is doing its best to see that it is properly carried out. But it seems that the Act has been rushed through without proper consideration.

TO THE ELECTORS

OF THE Electoral District OF LORNE

Having been requested by a number of friends to offer myself as a candidate for the coming election, I beg respectfully to announce that it is my intention to come forward, and if returned, I pledge myself to do all in my power to further the interests of Prince Albert and vicinity.

Yours sincerely,

A. E. PORTER, M.D.

Prince Albert - N.W.T

NOTICE.

To my Customers and the Public generally.

In thanking you for your kind patronage during the past four years I beg leave to inform you that I have added to my stock a large assortment of Harness, and obtained the services of a first-class workman in the shape of Mr. Smith, who is an expert in Harness, Fastening and Water Fixing, and will fit all Tin and Sheet Iron work generally.

Repairing neatly and promptly attended to.

My general stock of Harness has been greatly increased, and for price and quality cannot be equalled in town.

I hope by this notice to attract the notice of my customers to meet their continued patronage.

Respectfully yours,

T. J. AGNEW.

P.S. After April next place of business will be in the Masonic Temple.

FRESH OYSTERS

75cts per CAN.

AT Ashdown's
